title: Parametric Rates of Change - direction with trig

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2 pi"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals sin t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 cos t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, which way is the particle moving as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases from <math alttext="t equals fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 pi"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math> seconds?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

topic.text: 4.3: Parametric Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
